signals.context: 4 awards from Department of Defense to OKINAWA IDEMITSU K.K. during FY2023-Q1 fall within 10% below the $7,500,000 threshold (avg: $7,140,013.885).
4 awards from Department of Defense to OKINAWA IDEMITSU K.K. during FY2023-Q3 fall within 10% below the $7,500,000 threshold (avg: $7,053,947.618).
4 awards from Department of Defense to PACIFIC UNLIMITED INC during FY2023-Q2 fall within 10% below the $250,000 threshold (avg: $239,841.485).
3 awards from Department of Defense to EXXONMOBIL MARINE LIMITED during FY2023-Q2 fall within 10% below the $250,000 threshold (avg: $238,782.19).
3 awards from Department of Defense to SUMITOMO HEAVY INDUSTRIES, LTD during FY2023-Q2 fall within 10% below the $250,000 threshold (avg: $239,664.893).
3 awards from Department of Defense to EXXONMOBIL MARINE LIMITED during FY2023-Q3 fall within 10% below the $250,000 threshold (avg: $240,892.213).
3 awards from Department of Defense to BAE SYSTEMS GCS INTERNATIONAL LIMITED during FY2023-Q2 fall within 10% below the $250,000 threshold (avg: $239,680.13).

fiveCs.condition: 4 awards to Department of Defense were valued within 10% below the $7,500,000 threshold, suggesting possible structuring.
fiveCs.criteria: FAR 13.003 (Simplified Acquisition Threshold at $250,000) and other regulatory thresholds require additional oversight above certain dollar amounts. OCP Red Flags Guide (2024) identifies clustering below thresholds as a splitting indicator.
fiveCs.cause: Award values near thresholds may reflect standard project scoping, natural cost distributions, or deliberate structuring to avoid oversight requirements. Further analysis of timing and related awards is needed.
fiveCs.effect: $28,560,055.54 in awards may have avoided enhanced competition or oversight requirements that apply above the $7,500,000 threshold.
fiveCs.recommendation: Examine whether the near-threshold awards are for related work that could have been combined. Review timing and same-recipient patterns. Check if the same work was split across multiple awards to stay below the threshold.

signals.context: MURRAY BENJAMIN ELECTRIC CO LLC received 100.0% ($1,365,970.05) of spending in OTHER ALUMINUM ROLLING, DRAWING, AND EXTRUDING sector ($1,365,970.05 across 21 awards).
MURRAY BENJAMIN ELECTRIC CO LLC received 86.1% ($1,999,426.73) of spending in NONFERROUS METAL (EXCEPT COPPER AND ALUMINUM) ROLLING, DRAWING, AND EXTRUDING sector ($2,322,624.33 across 23 awards).
MURRAY BENJAMIN ELECTRIC CO LLC received 85.8% ($4,709,173.13) of spending in SWITCHGEAR AND SWITCHBOARD APPARATUS MANUFACTURING sector ($5,488,001.17 across 15 awards).

fiveCs.condition: MURRAY BENJAMIN ELECTRIC CO LLC received 100.0% of total spending, totaling $1,365,970.05 across 21 awards.
fiveCs.criteria: The EU Single Market Scoreboard tracks vendor concentration as a key procurement health indicator. Vendor shares exceeding 30% warrant review for market diversity. FAR 6.101 promotes full and open competition to prevent vendor lock-in.
fiveCs.cause: High concentration may reflect legitimate specialisation, unique capabilities, market structure (limited qualified suppliers), or insufficient effort to diversify the vendor base.
fiveCs.effect: Concentration of $1,365,970.05 with one vendor creates dependency risk and reduces competitive pricing leverage. Disruption to this vendor could significantly impact operations.
fiveCs.recommendation: Verify entity type via SAM.gov (FFRDC/UARC status may explain concentration). Assess whether vendor diversification programs are in place. Review comparable procurements from other agencies for benchmark concentration levels.

entityContext.naicsDescription: NONFERROUS METAL (EXCEPT COPPER AND ALUMINUM) ROLLING, DRAWING, AND EXTRUDING

signals.context: 787 of 2373 competitively-solicited contracts (33.2%) received only one bid. EU benchmark considers >20% as high-risk.

fiveCs.condition: Department of Defense received 788 competitively solicited awards, with a single-bid rate of 33.2% (262 awards received only one offer).
fiveCs.criteria: FAR 6.101 requires agencies to promote and provide for full and open competition. The EU Single Market Scoreboard flags single-bid rates above 20% as a concern indicator.
fiveCs.cause: Possible contributing factors include narrowly defined requirements, insufficient advertisement reach, or legitimate market specialisation. The pattern warrants review to determine the root cause.
fiveCs.effect: $2,511,137,973.78 in awards may not have benefited from competitive pricing pressure. Without multiple bidders, there is reduced assurance that the government received best value.
fiveCs.recommendation: Review solicitation practices for the flagged awards. Examine whether requirements can be broadened, advertisement improved, or set-aside categories adjusted to attract more bidders.

signals.context: Award W58P0522C0002 ($1,597,461,996) to GLAXOSMITHKLINE, LLC is 8.3x the category mean ($193,528,490.71) for 325412 (n=10). Upper fence: $3,428,222.85 (iqr method). Note: peer group limited to filtered dataset (n=10) and may not represent the full NAICS market.

fiveCs.condition: Award W58P0522C0002 valued at $1,597,461,996 is a statistical outlier (z-score: 8.30) within its NAICS/PSC category.
fiveCs.criteria: Statistical pricing analysis per OECD bid rigging guidelines. Awards exceeding 1.5x IQR above Q3 or z-score > 2.0 are flagged for price reasonableness review. FAR 15.404 requires price analysis for contract actions.
fiveCs.cause: Price outliers may reflect unique project scope, emergency procurement premiums, specialized requirements, or insufficient competition leading to higher prices.
fiveCs.effect: An award valued significantly above comparable procurements may indicate insufficient price negotiation or lack of competitive pricing pressure. Total exposure: $1,597,461,996.
fiveCs.recommendation: Review price analysis documentation. Compare with similar awards from other agencies. Examine competition method and number of offers. Verify whether the scope justifies the premium over comparable awards.

signals.context: 6 of 6 awards (100.0%) to ADVANCED ELECTRONICS COMPANY LIMITED were non-competitive. Non-competed amount: $231,512,195.59 (100.0% of total).

fiveCs.condition: 100.0% of awards (by count) to ADVANCED ELECTRONICS COMPANY LIMITED were non-competitive, totaling $231,512,195.59 across 6 awards.
fiveCs.criteria: FAR 6.302 permits non-competitive procurement only under specific circumstances (sole source, urgency, national security). OECD Guidelines (2025) flag persistent non-competitive patterns as a procurement integrity indicator.
fiveCs.cause: Non-competitive awards may reflect unique capabilities (e.g., FFRDC, UARC status), legitimate sole-source justifications, or habitual use of non-competitive mechanisms without adequate market research.
fiveCs.effect: $231,512,195.59 in awards bypassed competition. While individual justifications may be valid, the cumulative pattern reduces the transparency and competitiveness of the procurement portfolio.
fiveCs.recommendation: Verify sole-source justifications (J&A documentation) for the largest non-competitive awards. Check entity type via SAM.gov (FFRDC/UARC status may explain the pattern). Consider whether market research could identify additional qualified sources.
